dt: {bc}any of a family (Hippopotamidae) of very large, four-toed, chiefly aquatic, herbivorous {d_link|artiodactyl|artiodactyl} mammals having a very large head and mouth, nearly hairless thick grayish skin, long lower canine teeth, and relatively short legs, and including two living species:

{bc}one ({it}Hippopotamus amphibius{/it}) of sub-Saharan Africa that has webbing between the toes, spends most of the day in or near water, and typically weighs between 3 to 4 tons (2700 to 3600 kilograms)

et: Latin, from Greek {it}hippopotamos{/it}, alteration of {it}hippos potamios{/it}, literally, riverine horse
shortdef: any of a family (Hippopotamidae) of very large, four-toed, chiefly aquatic, herbivorous artiodactyl mammals having a very large head and mouth, nearly hairless thick grayish skin, long lower canine teeth, and relatively short legs, and including two living species:
one (Hippopotamus amphibius) of sub-Saharan Africa that has webbing between the toes, spends most of the day in or near water, and typically weighs between 3 to 4 tons (2700 to 3600 kilograms)
